adjectives.description: suffuse (comparative more suffuse, superlative most suffuse)

examples: This limonite-colored mud is most often very suffuse and only faintly apparent.

verbs.description: suffuse (third-person singular simple present suffuses, present participle suffusing, simple past and past participle suffused)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To spread through or over something, especially as a liquid, colour or light; to bathe.
examples: The entire room was suffused with a golden light.

entries.meaning: (transitive, figuratively) To spread through or over in the manner of a liquid.
examples: The warmth suffused his cold fingers.
